sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"种，类，类型"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: kind, sort, type, class, classification, category, species, variety
means: kind ： 指性质相同，而且特征很相似，足以归为一类的人或东西。
sort ： 普通用词，文体较kind随便，指对人或对事物进行的大概分类，有时含贬义。
type ： 指客观界限比较清楚，有相同本质特点的同类事物，或指大致相似的同类事物。
class ： 正式用词，指门类、种类或优劣等级；用于指动植物的分类时，表示"纲"。
classification ： 指根据已经确定的类型对某一实物作鉴别和归类。
category ： 书面用词，特指有确切定义的群体。
species ： 书面用词，单复数同形。指生物分类上的种。
variety ： 强调有各自的特点，形式不同，品质不同的种类。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"使有条理，安排"之意。
means: organize ： 指按计划或需要把人或物安排组织成一个整体。
arrange ： 指按计划、秩序、需要和可能等进行安排。
classify ： 指按照事物类型、质量或是否相似进行分类。
sort ： 通常指根据类型或种类分类或整理选择。

sentence.Network_en: I really feel aggrieved at this sort of thing.
sentence.Network_cn: 我真为这种事感到委屈。

sentence.Network_en: You can't put that sort of fear into words.
sentence.Network_cn: 那种恐惧无法用语言表达。

sentence.Network_en: Just how much kneading is required depends on the sort of flour.
sentence.Network_cn: 需要揉多久取决于用哪种面。

lj.lj_ly: I am in some sort indebted to you.
lj.lj_ls: 我在某种程度上要感谢你。

phrase.cizu_name: it takes all sorts to make a world

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)people vary greatly in character, tastes, and abilities (often used as a comment on what the speaker feels to be strange behaviour)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)世上的人无奇不有（常用来表示说话人对某种奇怪行为的评价）

lj.lj_ly: he was wearing make-up—well, it takes all sorts.
lj.lj_ls: 他居然化了妆——天啊，世上的人真是无奇不有。

jx.jx_en_mean: used as an emphatic way of denying permission or refuting an earlier statement or assumption
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用来断然否定或反驳先前的话语或设想］ 绝对不行，没那回事儿

lj.lj_ly: ‘I'll pay.’ ‘You'll do nothing of the sort.’.

jx.jx_en_mean: (或 of sorts)(informal)of a somewhat unusual and typically inferior kind
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)勉强称得上的，有点不寻常的

lj.lj_ly: the training camp actually became a tourist attraction of sorts.
lj.lj_ls: 这个训练营实际上近乎成了旅游观光的地方。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)to some extent; in some way or other (used to convey inexactness or vagueness)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)有点儿（表达不确切或模糊）

lj.lj_ly: ‘Do you see what I mean?’ ‘Sort of,’ answered Jean cautiously.
lj.lj_ls: “你明白我说的意思了吗？”“有点明白了，”琼小心翼翼地回答。

phrase.cizu_name: sort out the men from the boys

jx.jx_en_mean: show or prove who is the best at a particular activity
the kind of person likely to do or be involved with the thing specified

lj.lj_ly: she'd never imagined Steve to be the marrying sort.
lj.lj_ls: 她从来都没有想过史蒂夫会是想结婚的那一种人。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)deal with someone who is causing trouble, typically by restraining, reprimanding, or punishing them

lj.lj_ly: if he can't pay you, I'll sort him out.
lj.lj_ls: 要是他付不出钱给你，我会教训他的。

jx.jx_en_mean: separate something from a mixed group

lj.lj_ly: she started &B{sorting out} the lettuce &B{from} the spinach.
lj.lj_ls: 她开始把生菜从菠菜中拣出来。

lj.lj_ly: they are anxious to sort out travelling arrangements.
lj.lj_ls: 他们急着要做旅行安排。

jx.jx_en_mean: In a haphazard or imperfect way
jx.jx_cn_mean: 有点儿：以一种随意或者不完美的方式

lj.lj_ly: managed to paint the chair after a sort.

jx.jx_en_mean: Of a mediocre or inferior kind

lj.lj_ly: a constitutional government of a sort.
lj.lj_ls: 符合宪法的平庸的政府

jx.jx_cn_mean: 各种各样的，非此即彼的

lj.lj_ls: 知道许多各种各样的民间故事

phrase.cizu_name: of sorts 或 of a sort

lj.lj_ly: The teacher is out of sorts this morning.
lj.lj_ls: 今天上午老师心情不好

lj.lj_ly: “Gambling and prostitution . . . have been prohibited, but only sort of”(&b{George F. Will})
lj.lj_ls: “赌博与妓院…已经被查禁了，但只是有点儿不彻底”(&b{乔治F.威尔})

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French sorte, from an alteration of Latin sors, sort- 'lot, condition'

encyclopedia.content: 单词意思 名词n. [C] 1.种类，品种，类型 All sortsof lamps are available in that shop. 在那家商店可买到各式各样的灯具。 That's just the sortof thing I want. 那正是我所需要的那种东西。 2.性质；性格 3.锛埑Ｓ胄奘斡锪蔑級某种人，某类人[S1] She's a happy-go-lucky sort. 她是个乐天派。 4.方式，样子 5.【电脑】排序 及物动词vt. 1.把。..分类 They sortapples by grade. 他们把苹果按等级分类。 2.挑选，区分 Can'

entry.def: If you talk about a particular sort of something, you are talking about a class of things that have particular features in common and that belong to a larger group of related things.

example.ex: What sort of school did you go to?...
There are so many different sorts of mushrooms available these days...
example.tran: 现在可以买到许许多多不同种类的蘑菇。

entry.tran: 具有某种性格的人;某种人
entry.def: You describe someone as a particular sort when you are describing their character.

example.ex: He seemed to be just the right sort for the job...
example.tran: 他似乎正是干这个工作的合适人选。

example.ex: She was a very vigorous sort of person...
example.tran: 她是那种精力非常充沛的人。

entry.def: If you sort things, you separate them into different classes, groups, or places, for example so that you can do different things with them.

example.ex: He sorted the materials into their folders...
example.tran: 他把材料分门别类放进了文件夹。

example.ex: The students are sorted into three ability groups...
example.tran: 学生们被按照各自的能力分成了 3 个组。

entry.def: If you get a problem or the details of something sorted, you do what is necessary to solve the problem or organize the details.

example.ex: I'm trying to get my script sorted...
example.tran: 我正努力把手稿的内容理顺。

example.ex: These problems have now been sorted.
example.tran: 这些问题现在已经解决了。

entry.tran: 各种各样的;形形色色的
entry.def: All sorts of things or people means a large number of different things or people.

example.ex: There are all sorts of animals, including bears, pigs, kangaroos, and penguins...
example.tran: 有各种各样的动物，包括熊、猪、袋鼠和企鹅。

example.ex: It was used by all sorts of people...
example.tran: 各种各样的人都使用它。

entry.tran: 勉强称得上…的;低劣的;一般的;起码的
entry.def: If you describe something as a thing of sorts or as a thing of a sort, you are suggesting that the thing is of a rather poor quality or standard.

example.ex: He made a living of sorts selling pancakes from a van...
example.tran: 他靠用货车卖薄饼勉强度日。

example.ex: She even managed a grimacing smile of sorts...

entry.tran: 有几分;近似;有那么点儿
entry.def: You use sort of when you want to say that your description of something is not very accurate.

example.ex: You could even order windows from a catalogue — a sort of mail order stained glass service...
example.tran: 你甚至可以根据目录订购窗户——可以说是一种邮购彩色玻璃的业务。

example.ex: In the end, she sort of pushed it...
example.tran: 最后，她几乎是用了推的。

entry.tran: 身体不适;心情不佳;烦恼
entry.def: If you are out of sorts, you feel slightly unwell, upset, or annoyed.

means.word_mean: 1. a category of things distinguished by some common characteristic or quality;

sentences.sentence: "she wore a sort of magenta dress"
"she served a creamy sort of dessert thing"

means.word_mean: 3. a person of a particular character or nature;
4. an operation that segregates items into groups according to a specified criterion;

sentences.sentence: "the bottleneck in mail delivery it the process of sorting"

means.word_mean: 1. examine in order to test suitability;
2. arrange or order by classes or categories;

sentences.sentence: "How would you classify these pottery shards--are they prehistoric?"

Sentence.sentence: The best comments are then sorted democratically by a voting system, meaning that your social learning experience is shared with the best and brightest thinkers.
According to O'Sullivan culture also shapes the sorts of feelings we expect to have, and actually do experience, when in love.
He knows what sort of person Jane is.
And what sort of car did you have in mind?
The result is a sort of high-quality, unusually rigorous coffee-table book, designed to be dipped into rather than read from beginning to end.
Self-image is the picture you have of yourself, the sort of person you believe you are.

sentences.en: All sorts of sleeping bags have been developed and many have been given extensive trials under various conditions.
sentences.cn: 各式的睡袋被试制出来, 并且有许多曾在不同条件下广泛试用。

sentences.en: That sort of boy is loved by everyone.
The salesman sorted his new consignment of stockings.
sentences.cn: 推销员把新到的一批长袜清理分类。

means.word_mean: 挑选，拣出，区分(常与out连用)

sentences.en: to sort the good from the bad

sentences.cn: 把鸡蛋不按等级胡乱归类

jushi.english: Your job is to sort the letters according to their destinations.
jushi.chinese: 你的工作是按投递地址分拣信件。
我们按主题对书进行分类。

jushi.english: You had better send somebody over to sort the situation.
jushi.chinese: 你最好还是派人去弄清情况。
